trans-unit.source: Writes a value to a standard format .ini file.

trans-unit.source: A standard ini file looks like:

seg-source.mrk: A standard ini file looks like:

target.mrk: A standard ini file looks like:

trans-unit.source: If the file does not already exist, it is created so long as the directory exists. Keys and/or sections are added to the end and are not sorted in any way.

seg-source.mrk: If the file does not already exist, it is created so long as the directory exists.
Keys and/or sections are added to the end and are not sorted in any way.

target.mrk: If the file does not already exist, it is created so long as the directory exists.
Keys and/or sections are added to the end and are not sorted in any way.

trans-unit.source: If you would like to wrap quotes around an ini value, then you need to double up the quotation marks as the first set of quotation marks are stripped. For example: ""This is a test"" will produce "This is a test" when using IniRead() or such-like.

seg-source.mrk: If you would like to wrap quotes around an ini value, then you need to double up the quotation marks as the first set of quotation marks are stripped.
""This is a test"" will produce "This is a test" when using IniRead() or such-like.

target.mrk: If you would like to wrap quotes around an ini value, then you need to double up the quotation marks as the first set of quotation marks are stripped.
""This is a test"" will produce "This is a test" when using IniRead() or such-like.

trans-unit.source: Leading and trailing whitespace is stripped. In order to preserve the whitespace, the string must be quoted. For example, " this is a test" will preserve the whitespace but per above, the quotation marks are stripped.

seg-source.mrk: Leading and trailing whitespace is stripped.
In order to preserve the whitespace, the string must be quoted.
For example, " this is a test" will preserve the whitespace but per above, the quotation marks are stripped.

target.mrk: Leading and trailing whitespace is stripped.
In order to preserve the whitespace, the string must be quoted.
For example, " this is a test" will preserve the whitespace but per above, the quotation marks are stripped.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use an ini file with Unicode encoding, first create an .ini file by using the FileOpen() function with the mode parameter set to a Unicode parameter.

seg-source.mrk: If you want to use an ini file with Unicode encoding, first create an .ini file by using the FileOpen() function with the mode parameter set to a Unicode parameter.

target.mrk: If you want to use an ini file with Unicode encoding, first create an .ini file by using the FileOpen() function with the mode parameter set to a Unicode parameter.
